of his mouth read to the Austrian gen- eral the following passage, in German, from the Archduke Ferdinand's letter: 
We have fully concentrated forces of nearly seventy thousand men with whitfi to attack and defeat the enemy should he cross the Lech. Also, as we are masters of Ulm, we cannot be deprived of the advantage of commanding both sides of the Danube, so that should the enemy not cross the Lech, we can cross the Danube, throw ourselves on his line of communications, recross the
